required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Avastin in First Line in Elderly Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer (CASSIOPEE)
clinical_study.official_title: Non Interventional Study Evaluating Efficacy and Safety in a Cohort of Elderly Patients of First Line Therapy With Avastin Â® Regimen for Metastatic Colorectal Cancer.

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, prospective, observational study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of Avastin (bevacizumab) in first-line therapy in elderly patients with metastatic colorectal cancer. Data will be collected from eligible patients for24 months.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study treatment to the time of disease progression or death from any cause (Up to 53 months)
primary_outcome.description: Progression was defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0), as a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study treatment to the time of death from any cause (Up to 53 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time between the treatment start date (date of the first infusion of bevacizumab) and date of all-cause death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Bevacizumab Administration
Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was considered any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
secondary_outcome.description: The Katz Activity of Daily Living (ADL) questionnaire scale contains 6 items evaluating in terms of autonomy or dependence the patient's ability to carry out basic activities of daily living (bathing, dressing, toileting, transfer, continence, feeding). Total score range 0 (low) to 6 (high). High score indicates participant is independent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Score (IADL)
secondary_outcome.description: The Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale (IADL) is an appropriate instrument to assess independent living skills. The instrument is most useful for identifying how a participant is functioning at the present time and for identifying improvement or deterioration over time. There are 8 domains of function measured with the Lawton IADL scale (telephone use, shopping, cooking, housekeeping, laundry, mode of transportation, responsibility of own medications, and ability to handle finances). Participants are scored according to their level of functioning from 0 (low function, dependent) to 8 (high function, independent). Higher score for each domain represents better functional performance of the older people.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Balducci Score
secondary_outcome.description: Balducci score defines an algorithm for the individual participant according to age, ADL and modified IADL 4-items scores, estimated performance status and comorbidities, particularly cardiovascular, cancer, depression or anemia. Balducci score is categorized in the following- Type 1 (Harmonious), Type 2 (Intermediate) and Type 3 (Frail). Type 1 indicates better results and Type 3 indicates worse outcomes.

study_pop.textblock: Elderly patients with metastatic colorectal cancer initiating first-line treatment with Avastin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/= 75 years of age
- Metastatic colorectal cancer
- Initiating Avastin first-line therapy in combination with chemotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous Avastin therapy
- Patient participating in a clinical study evaluating a cytotoxic anti-cancer therapy and/or an investigational new drug

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 402 participants were enrolled from 100 French sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The data in the study for participant flow, baseline characteristics, outcome measure and adverse events was collected for overall participants and not as per the dose administered to participants.

group.title: Bevacizumab
group.description: Participants received initial dose of either 5 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) every 2 weeks or 7.5 mg/kg every 3 weeks of bevacizumab irrespective of the age subgroup.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: 75 years old or more ticked No
Death linked to progression of disease
Death linked to an adverse event

baseline.population: The efficacy population included all participants who had at least one infusion of bevacizumab, without exclusion criteria and excluding participants with no intake of chemotherapy, or intake of bevacizumab before or 2 months after chemotherapy initiation. Data in the study was collected for overall participants and not as per dose administered.

group.title: Bevacizumab
group.description: Participants received initial dose of either 5 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) every 2 weeks or 7.5 mg/kg every 3 weeks of bevacizumab irrespective of the age subgroup.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival
outcome.description: Progression was defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0), as a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study treatment to the time of disease progression or death from any cause (Up to 53 months)
outcome.population: The efficacy population (EFF) included all participants who had at least one infusion of bevacizumab, without exclusion criteria and excluding participants with no intake of chemotherapy, or intake of bevacizumab before or 2 months after chemotherapy initiation. Data in study was collected for overall participants and not as per dose administered.

outcome.title: Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Score (IADL)
outcome.description: The Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale (IADL) is an appropriate instrument to assess independent living skills. The instrument is most useful for identifying how a participant is functioning at the present time and for identifying improvement or deterioration over time. There are 8 domains of function measured with the Lawton IADL scale (telephone use, shopping, cooking, housekeeping, laundry, mode of transportation, responsibility of own medications, and ability to handle finances). Participants are scored according to their level of functioning from 0 (low function, dependent) to 8 (high function, independent). Higher score for each domain represents better functional performance of the older people.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsorâs intellectual property rights.
